name: One Busy Turn
description: pretty much try to get the most points in one turn

name: Stealth Kit
description:
Pretty straightforward, I think. Plenty of Stealth creds from Lockpick, Cloak, and Ghost Runner. Refractor is insanely efficient, so with Paintbrush you should be set to get in just about anywhere. Legwork, Escher, and The Maker's Eye (and Same Old Thing) make those runs count. Daily Casts is good, because with Paintbrush you really can't afford to have to click for credits often. SMC helps get Refractor out quickly and then can be used to pull Paintbrush, Cloaks, or other breakers as needed. Parasite for when they put Quandary on the outside of a server.

Econ is standard and seems sufficient so far, especially with the recurring stealth creds. Dirty Laundry is especially awesome because you can use it to "launder" your recurring creds into real creds.

BOX-E is good, but I'm considering replacing with CyberSolutions to squeeze out influence for another Parasite. Will continue to play-test and see how it works.

name: Scorched Programs
description:
Update from an old deck I used to have that was built to rush agendas as quick you can with chimeras and such, and then kill programs to give you opportunities to close out.

The general idea is still there, but now much leaner and meaner with Will-o'-the-Wisp and Lotus Field. Don't click for creds, always draw for more options.

Would love to put in Targeted Marketing, but constrained by influence.

the original (on hindsight a bit messy) deck here: http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/2621/weyland-scorched-programs

name: KitBox V2.0
description: This is version 2 of my KitBox, removed sacrificial construct and personal workshop, added another copy of R&D interface and 2 copies of modded. pretty straightforward, use SMC/testrun +scavenge to tutor programs quickly, install yog.0 on dinosaurus and use datasucker tokens for those slightly out of range ice strength as well as parasite to remove unwanted ice, Clone chips to recur trashed programs and Paintbrush to color any rezzed ice subtypes to codegate for the free yog entry

name: Banks closed on account of Noise.
description:
I figured to try to change the 'Anatomy of Anarchy' playstyle a bit. I fully agree that Account Siphon is an Anarch card in disguise, and I absolutely love it. So I thought, well if they see that I have account siphons, they're just going to ICE HQ, so how can we move their ice from HQ to other servers to allow me to get Siphons off better?

Simple: Threaten other servers. Now, Keyhole is probably the best R&D tool to do this, as it not only creates a need for ICE on R&D, but it also creates a need for ICE on Archives. Now, most anatomy of anarchy decks were running Reina because more taxing means Corp has less money overall, and it worked great. But I decided to go with Noise, creating a much higher threat on Archives. A lot of people are going to be thinking 'Noise Mill' is going to become the main thing that you're doing as Noise and not just a side-effect of what he's trying to push you towards.

So lets get into card choices, why don't we?

Account Siphon : I chose this to be the main focus because of it creating a need to ice HQ, so if I start doing this, then they either ice the hell out of HQ or get siphoned, and if they do ice HQ, then I get easier access to R&D with Keyhole, and even better access to Archives.

Dirty Laundry: I absolutely love this card for a ton of reasons. First turn stuff is the best. Install Datasucker, Corp trashes off the top of R&D, play Dirty Laundry, Run archives, get a possible agenda, and net 3 credits and get a datasucker token!

Express Delivery: This is a vital part of this deck. Corp left HQ un-iced first turn and didn't get a siphon in your hand? Express Delivery it out (if it's within 4 cards) and get yourself a shit ton of money.

Grimoire: I decided to go with Grimoire as the console, just because it's 2 mem for 3 credits, which is really great efficiency as I'm most likely going to have Corroder/Mimic/Yog/Datasucker/Keyhole as a complete rig, With Knights serving their purpose if things get weird in terms of ICE. My favorite part of Parasites is that they are ultimately temporary, and free up memory space after creating windows of opportunity.

John Masanori: Not a fan of Wyldside because of the huge waste of click per turn if you don't need anything new, without Aesops it's kind of out of control. So John Masanori is great for drawing, worst case scenario I get a tag that I don't care about.

Liberated Account: "Why do you have 3 armitage and some liberated?" Because to put it simply, I can net more credits in 2 turns this way. If I'm being starved on credits (AKA: They iced the hell out of HQ and I don't have efficient breaking potential at the moment. If I have both Armitage and a Liberated account in my hand, I can easily get to 12 credits in 2 turns. (Note: 2 Armitages would get you 6 the first turn, play click click click, because lets be honest, is a corp going to let you have a stable economy when you have tags left and right? So if they trash, then you can just play a liberated and click 3 times for 12 credits, and they'll most likely try to trash that too, costing them 4 credits and 2 clicks to delete your econ that you've already made 12 credits off of.)

Data Leak Reversal: Just adds more need to ICE archives, or you get a lot of access to cards, also puts the game on more of a clock than before, as you'll only most likely get 6 - 8 cards into archives from Noise's ability. Most likely far less.

Just my thoughts on how to play this version of Noise. I haven't play-tested this deck, but I'll most likely make a shit ton of mistakes like I always do ^^ But this should be fun to play at least! Lot of misdirection and ice killing muwahah!

Any suggestions are welcome!

name: Information Overflow
description: Let the Runner steals one Agenda, use MR to flood him with tags, surprise him with Information Overload to wipe out his rig, then punish with SE. Also included: astrotrain, powered by Psycho.

name: OverQuetzal
description:
A new concept that doesn't use darwin!

Overmind with Test Run, Retrieval Run and Levy means you can always get in. Duggar's is used for ridiculous draw power that it brings, plus it works well with Box-E (move hand size is always nice) - which combo's with overmind!
With dominantly events, same old thing lets you replay what you throw out from Duggar's. Also click-less economy from daily casts is needed to help support the loss of a turn from duggar's.

name: Andy Flurry
description:
An Andy that maximizes an economy that is entirely dependent on running. You don't have time for Kati Jones or even Account Siphon, just keep accessing, make sure your John Masanori triggers, your Datasucker are loaded, and you get Grifter cash. Security Testing is amazing here too,

Note the main "puzzle" of the deck is knowing what to Parasite. You only get to do it twice here, so make sure it counts.

Would love to fit Legwork in here, but unfortunately in the interest of needing your infrastructure cards to turn up early and thus 3x of each, there's no space for it. Try to make up for it with a higher number of HQ single accesses. That said, this deck will die to most CI builds.

Lotus Fields tend to be placed on centrals once the Corp sees you are running Yog.0 and Datasucker, so Passport is an arguably better choice as a decoder than Peacock here.

Incredibly fun and exhilarating to pilot this deck. It's the Criminal "run and gun" never-stop idea in the extreme.

name: Eat my Trash 2.0
description:
I'm not a Jinteki expert but i would love to have a Jinteki deck, just for fun to mess around with my netrunner gaming buddies. The idea is delay the runner score as much as possible and for that i'll be using Shi.Kyū traps and Susanoo-No-Mikoto ice to deflect the runner to my unprotected archives were he will have to deal with any Shock! there, and some ETR and damage via House of Knives and Nisei MK II tokens.

The identity chosen will provide some Sundew income alongside with NeoTokyo Grid and the operation cards chosen.

Lot's of Code Gate ICE to protect me, which i hope will benefit from Encrypted Portals strength boost as well as giving also some credits :)

With Braintrust i'll try to lower down the advancement cost of all other agendas and with Medical Breakthrough i'll have double the bonus.

I have not tried this yet, but in my head it might work :) So suggestions and comments are very well appreciated.

name: AC/DC
description:
Econ: PPVP with Dirty Laundry, Sure Gamble and Lucky Find; Desperado + Security Testing; Stimhack + Savoir-faire; 13 run events + Ken.

Breakers: standard Corroder with Breach just in case; 3xFaerie, Femme, Garrote may be an overkill, but you may need it against Grim/Archer when you run out of Faeries; 2x Peacocks, it's not Gordian, but it's influence free. Enigma/Yagura are hard, but you don't have to break both subs.

Multi-access: 3x Maker's Eye and 3x Legwork are usually enough.

Tips and tricks: Stimhack + Savoir-faire for Femme with 1c cost; Crescentus and Faerie for big sentries and other high cost ices, you can Savoir-faire them; with Savoir-faire you may keep info about your breakers for yourself, corp doesn't know what to rez; don't trash installed traps, you may use them for Security Testing; remember to run archives ones in a while without Security Testing them; don't install more than 2 PPVP.

Hand to mulligan for - econ, PPVP, Savoir-faire, breakers(especially Faerie)/Special Order, Desperado/Security Testing. You don't want Stimhack or Legwork (corp will mostly defend hq against criminal), sometimes Maker's Eye is good in starting hand, but don't mulligan for it.

No Same Old Thing - you need 3 clicks to play event again, it's too slow and you don't have any essential events you must play more times. No Siphons, Datasuckers, Parasites - because they're boring and there's no place for them. Also good corp will be ready for Siphon.

If I had more influence/deck space I'd probably add Net Celebrity, Three Steps Ahead, Planned Assault.

I don't know if it's the best you can get out of Ken, but it's really good and it's not Andy. :)

name: OMG WTF
hb fast advance
description: cheap and taxing fast advancing

name: Flatline Shellgame
QuE3tzal
Exposed Andy V1.1
description:
Oh Andy, I love it when you expose ices like that... specially using that Blackguard to force the corp to rez them... yes, don´t stop my dear, you can combine it with your Snitch oh yeah, that´s it! (just some minor adjustements from my previous version)

You can even expose more cards with Lemuria Codecracker to ensure we won´t have a bad time running on a remote server!

Furthermore, thanks to the Unscheduled Maintenance we can force the corp to build their ice towers step by step, thus allowing us to launch our run events more effectively

You are the best dear

name: QUe3N's Tax
description: Just a typical Reina Roja: Freedom Fighter deck that tries to exploit D4v1d, Knight and Overmind as much as possible using e3 Feedback Implants.

name: Double-Bluff Astrobiotics
description:
Bluff normal Astrobiotics until the runner sees a tag/tag punishment card, then bluff Scorch. If the runner slows down, score out. If he gets Plascrete down and runs like he has no pants on, Midseason/Psychographics for the win.

I'd need to actually test this to determine proper numbers of Midseason/Psycho/Fast Track/Closed Accounts, and to check if the Atman4 weakness exists.

name: HB - Core + C&C - Bioptic Takeover 2.0
Kit - Core + C&C + Cyber Exodus - Poor Man's Kit 2.0
The Mask of Santiago
Unwelcome Advances
Mitochondrial Myth
description:
Another deck exploiting Quetzal's identity power with e3.

I've been convinced by arguments that Q's ability doesn't lend itself to a sufficient number of runs each turn to justify Desperado, so I opted to use that influence to ensure I draw e3 Feedback Implants with Express Delivery and have some pressure on HQ with Legwork. This also freed me up to try out Spinal Modem which I've been keen to playtest but haven't done so since the other identities seem better suited to different consoles. The risk inherent in this console seems acceptable to me and rather than build link, I opted for a flush economy.

Both Knight and Imp may move themselves out of the deck after some initial playtesting. Memory will be tight with this rig. Scrubbed, Cyberfeeder, or Dyson Mem Chip are potential replacements.

name: Fix It 'N' Trade It
description:
So this is what i am currently planning on running when Up & Over Comes out. with all the Blue Sun decks coming i am thinking having the capability to take down a huge costing ICE turn one will be very useful to have, that's were D4V1D comes in to deal with those OAI ICE an deny the corp cash and ICE.

I really like spinal modem i think it and Desperado are probably the best value consoles around. So link str is good for using that and rabbit hole fits the bill perfect, pulling double duty as link str and trade in targets to really get the deck rolling.

I am not a 100% sure about the deck this way however i feel i could also change -1 spinal , -1 Creeper, -1snowball for +1 Dino +1 Corroder +1 Aesop's.

This would allow me to dino the femme removing the need for creeper, with spinal gone i can upgrade snowball to corroder with the spare influence and aesop's to get some cash back on used up D4V1D's i plan to get back in with test/clone or no longer required rabbits and 1 more creds from armitage's not a massive use for aesop's but enough at least.

Thoughts / Comments?

name: Dec@Day.11 - Buy Me Dinner First
description:
Dec@Day - Every identity, one day and deck at a time. It's like NaNoWriMo for Netrunner! More info in my profile.

Andromeda doesn't even try to hide her advantage--right from Turn 1, she has all the cards. Any deck following her footsteps is going to try to take off quickly and never look back. Unfortunately, this leads to criminally few ways of making her unique...and as much as I tried, Capstone just wasn't going to work out. :)

Cheap breakers combined with credits for making runs and multi-access mean we can hit hard and often. Making the Corp spend credits repeatedly doesn't hurt either.

Questions, comments, or suggestions? Feel free--I'm doing this to improve my deckbuilding skills, and input's welcome. Tomorrow is a little different, as I cheat just a little and show the NBN of Tomorrow (or at least, the end of this data pack cycle.)

Previous Dec@Day Decks:

  • 01 HB: EtF - Fix It in Beta
  • 02 An: Noise - Trojan Whale
  • 03 Ji: PE - Sword of Damocles
  • 04 Cr: Gabe - By Hook or By Crook
  • 05 NBN: MN - Watching Out for You
  • 06 Sh: Kate - The Art Thief
  • 07 We: BaBW - Surcharges Apply
  • 08 HB: ST - Talk Isn't Cheap
  • 09 An: Whiz - The Most Dangerous Game
  • 10 Ji: RP - Clicks of Our Lives
  • R1 Ji: PE Sword of Damocles 2.0

name: Mezozoic era
description: Trying out quetzal

name: Exposing Engine
description:
1) Play Social Engineering on an unrezzed piece of ICE; 2) Run (as an option using Running Interference) and Snitch it; 3) Force the Corp to rez it with Blackguard; 4) Gain credits equal to its rez cost; 5) Derez it with Emergency Shutdown. 6) Repeat from step 1 next turn.

Inspired by @seiya Exposed Andy deck!

name: Doggar Dance Party
description:
Who let the dogs out?

i'm sorry

name: Sneaky Clone
description: A Dagger / Paintbrush deck using your neighborhood friendly clone: Ken "Express" Tenma: Disappeared Clone!

name: Rielle Talk 2.0
description:
Refurbishing my "Rielle Talk" deck with some needed changes and turning the main archetype into Stealth Breakers. This is a Pseudo Big Rig Efficiency deck that happens to be pretty easy to set up since Kit really only needs a Refractor to be ready to roll.

The idea is to get in efficiently and cheap. Refractor is an insane decoder that's quick to install early and stays relevant. If you start with an opening hand of any stealth credit (Lockpick/Cloak/Ghost Runner) and Refractor/SMC, no early game ICE is going to stop you.

Paintbrush is in the deck for when you're facing giant servers, but it's probably not needed most of the time. The only reason such a situational card is still in the deck is because it goes so well with Kit and it can be an absolute game-changer.

Leprechaun has been pulling its weight as a great memory alternative. Leprechaun is for housing Magnum Opus, Paintbrush, and any of your SMC's. It's basically paying 2 credits for 3 memory. Alongside BOX-E and Omnidrive, memory hasn't been an issue.

Early game economy is important! Later on, you'll be running efficiently with tons of recurring credits, but in the opening stages, getting your rig installed as you run with Refractor gets expensive. Honestly, an opening hand with Magnum Opus alone is worth it because you'll be set for the rest of the game.

Overall, this is a fun deck that is unstoppable if you get equipped with your essentials early on.

name: She Moves Diagonally
description: She prefers Draughts to chess, she paints, carves ice, she's heavily armoured and she liberates your accounts.

name: Rielle Talk 2.0
description:
Refurbishing my "Rielle Talk" deck with some needed changes and turning the main archetype into Stealth Breakers. This is a Pseudo Big Rig Efficiency deck that happens to be pretty easy to set up since Kit really only needs a Refractor to be ready to roll.

name: Blue Sun - WTFBBQ?!?  No Scorched! No Jackson!
description:
I'd love to post some background to this deck, but honestly I'm too lazy. Hopefully this stirs up some ideas on bringing Weyland back into the mix.

I've tested it, it works, it's not FA so I've enjoyed playing it alot. Priority Requisitions could be Government contracts, but eventually will be High Risk Investments.

I'm not 100% sure about Off the grid due to its high rez cost and 0 trash cost but it has obviously synergy with Port Anson Grid. You could also try out 2 copies of GRNDL Refinery instead.

Feel free to ask me questions. I may or may not answer.

name: D.E.T.A.I.N (Don't even think about it Noise)
description: Make a beefy HQ server with Crisium Grid and score two 3 pointers in Off the Grid server. Detain Noise in archives with Susan.

name: APE 1.0©
description:
/rez cheap ICE/

/do mushin!/

/6$ + fast track + biotic + trick, score 2PT out of r&d/

/be loose&unpredictable/

/loose hard vs. noise/

/be gentle/

/become APE©/
